definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: The boys wore black tail coats in mourning for George III.
sentences.chinese: 男孩身穿黑色燕尾服爲喬治三世服喪。

sentences.english: Don't greet people who are in mourning.
sentences.chinese: 不要向服喪期的人們問候拜年。

sentences.english: When Confucius is eating with a mourner, he never satiated himself.
sentences.chinese: 孔子跟服喪的人喫飯時，從來不喫飽。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to be in overall charge/to oversee
to keep an appointment/to keep one's word
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
Huailai county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
